antiSpamFilter

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • antiSpamFilter.Functions

  • public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    Functions is the class that contains the functions that allow the application to get the rules, that are used to see if a message is spam or ham or if its is false positive or false negative, to have their weights altered, to save that new alteration, and to count how many false positives and false negatives are in the spam.log and ham.log.
    Author:
    Nuno Fialho EIC1 72910, Sandro Ferreira EIC1 72911, Duarte Pinto EIC1 73117

        public static RP[] getRules(java.lang.String path)
        Function that obtains the rules written in a file to an array.

        path - is the directory of the file
        Returns:
        rules that is an array with the name of the rules and it's weight

        Function that read the automatic results
        Returns:
        the rules that were read

      • readConfig

        public static RP[] readConfig(int index)
        Function that reads the weights of the rules created by the jMetal Algorithm
        Parameters:
        index - of the weight that we want to read
        Returns:
        a vector of Regras and Pesos (Rules + Weights)

      • Fn

        public static int Fn(RP[] rules,
                     java.lang.String spam)
        Function that counts the number of false negatives that exist in the spam.log file
        Parameters:
        rules - are the rules to test the messages
        spam - is the message that is being tested to see if it is false negative
        Returns:
        the number of false negatives messages are in the spam.log file

      • Fp

        public static int Fp(RP[] rules,
                     java.lang.String ham)
        Function that counts the number of false positives exist in the ham.log file
        Parameters:
        rules - are the rules to test the messages
        ham - is the message that is being tested to see if it is false positive
        Returns:
        the number of false positives messages are in the ham.log file

      • getVector

        public static java.lang.Object[][] getVector(RP[] x)
        Function that separates the rules and it's weights
        Parameters:
        x - is a vector of rules and it's weight (RP)
        Returns:
        an matrix with the rules and it´s weight separated
